intro: Barbarea vulgaris var. perennis, commonly known as winter cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright stems covered in small, translucent, waxy leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers in early spring, which are followed by heart-shaped, edible pods containing tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Winter cress is known for its peppery flavor and has been used in traditional cuisines and herbal remedies.
